@PhilFarmVet @sunkfarmer @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency Indeed. Some bits (the Tor) occupied in the Mesolithic; Roman settlements in many places; Anglo Saxon drainage and so on. Alfred's burnt cakes. Fascinating place - and full of Reed Warblers when I last visited.

tweets.text: @Drystonesonnet @sunkfarmer @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency Please read the thread as a thread. Jono's suggestion was not to build on flood plains. All I was saying is that the levels are and always will be mainly flood plains and not building on them isn't an option. They need to be managed.

Accompanied by the usual BS statements from the @EnvAgency "We do allow storm overflows to discharge exceptionally into chalk streams".

Last time I checked, which was last week, TW had been dumping sewage into the River Chess for the 6th day in a row. Exceptional? https://t.co/N2khh8uHfr

@sunkfarmer @PhilFarmVet @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency Really? And you from Sunk Island....üò≥

I visited later in the early summer when dredging had just begun. It was very slow to start with and we were worried that EA were messing about. In the end they got it done OK and I don't think there has been a problem since.
@sunkfarmer @Drystonesonnet @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency Some were there before the planning departments existed.

tweets.text: @PhilFarmVet @Drystonesonnet @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency And the planning departments are stupid for dreaming up idiotic ideas that housing belongs on flood plains, they don't.

@AgainstSewage @EnvAgency This property owner should be forced to instal a waste water treatment system this filthy water clearly isn‚Äôt just the water from the soak away which has probably failed üí©üò¨if this was coming onto my property I would block it up üí©

@pastoralview @Drystonesonnet @agricontract @EnvAgency @westyeo This needs doing in so many parts of the country but more emphasis is put on preserving water voles homes than peoples homes, businesses and food production.
@360wastesupport @EnvAgency @CrimestoppersUK Sort of soily, you know. Good enough to hide in something that looks like soil.

I have a question for @Defra / @EnvAgency.

Are government department / agency comms teams allowed to blatantly and deliberately mislead the press?

@EnvAgencySE The water hasn't even reached them

@PhilFarmVet @sunkfarmer @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency Thank you. That was all I wanted to know.

I agree that people live there and need to be protected from the flooding experienced in 2013(?) and that the only way of doing that was to dredge to some degree. The 'no-dredge' policy was a disaster.

@WGowyRivers @CRTNorthWest @GroundworkCLM @EnvAgencyNW @BiomatrixWater We worked with Biomatrix too. Worked very well together to get these installed and the floating gardens are already getting really positive feedback from people using the canal in the area. Can't wait to see the gardens fully established.
And the @EnvAgency do what exactly? https://t.co/w5iKrcWbIQ
Says it all really. A policy of appeasement @EnvAgency. Anger mounts over 120,000 tonnes of illegally dumped waste  https://t.co/KH17Gq9qDn

@Drystonesonnet @sunkfarmer @westyeo @pastoralview @wheat_daddy @agricontract @EnvAgency Management of flow of water. Encouraging the water to flow in the rivers. Building up of banks, but doing with respect to the wildlife around. That would be my thoughts but I am not an expert on this and that was not my point. My point was people live on flood plains.
